headline: Asian stocks in retreat as traders eye Fed decision, tech earnings
summary: Asian markets retreated Wednesday following a tepid day on Wall Street as investors bided their time ahead of a highly anticipated Federal Reserve policy announcement later in the day.With US central bankers expected to cut interest rates for the third straight session later Wednesday, the main focus is on their post-meeting statement, boss Jerome Powell's news conference and the "dot plot" forecast for 2026 policy.

content.title: Asian stocks in retreat as traders eye Fed decision, tech earnings

headline: AI Chips Update - AI-Driven Cybersecurity Surge Amid Rising Threats
summary: Recent developments in AI-integrated cybersecurity solutions have intensified as enterprises face a surge in AI-weaponized cyberattacks, up 156% by late 2025. Many companies are urgently enhancing security frameworks with quantum-resistant cryptography and zero trust architectures to address this evolved threat landscape. Highlighted solutions include Quantum Secure Encryption Corp's (QSE) launch of the qREK Software Development Kit, which empowers developers with tools for quantum-resilient...

headline: Marvell CEO fights back against bears; stock gains
summary: Investing.com -- Marvell Technology Inc (NASDAQ:MRVL) shares surged over 2.7% Wednesday, paring some losses after CEO Matt Murphy forcefully denied reports that the semiconductor company had lost key business with hyperscale customers Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT). In a Tuesday interview with CNBCâ€™s Jim Cramer, Murphy aggressively pushed back on speculation that had sent the stock spiraling earlier in the week, insisting, â€œfrom Tuesday to Friday, nothing changed.
